arts.ttl: Lazio Furious With Penalty Debacle Against Fiorentina
arts.sum: Lazio were left irritated and displeased by Matteo Marcenaro’s refereeing decisions that led to their away defeat at the hands of Fiorentina. The contest was marred by several controversial episodes which directly influenced the result. arts.ttl: Gudmundsson Spot-Kicks Complete Fiorentina Turnaround Against Lazio
arts.sum: Lazio suffered their second defeat on the road in as many attempts this season, as Fiorentina rallied from behind to earn their first win of the campaign. arts.ttl: Serie A | Fiorentina 2-1 Lazio: Match Report
arts.sum: Icelandic striker Albert Gudmundsson made an unforgettable debut for Fiorentina, scoring two penalties to secure a 2-1 victory over Lazio and give the Viola their first win of the season. The triumph came as a relief for Fiorentina, who had struggled to find form in both Serie A and the Conference League. The match began with both teams creating opportunities. Lazio goalkeeper Ivan Provedel made a spectacular save early on, deflecting Andrea Colpani’s shot onto the post. At the other end, David De Gea was equally impressive for Fiorentina, denying Mattia Zaccagni with a strong near-post save. arts.ttl: Fiorentina’s Palladino: “Gudmundsson will be called up. Commisso? he brings enthusiasm”
arts.sum: As Fiorentina prepare to host Lazio in the fifth round of Serie A on Sunday, manager Raffaele Palladino addressed the media, sharing updates on player availability and the team’s mindset. Palladino began with positive news about a key player’s return: “Gudmundsson will be called up. We’re happy, he’s trained with the group all week and has held up well, despite his inactivity due to injury. He’s worked well and brought positive energy. We can’t wait to see him on the field.” The coach also commented on the recent visit of club president Rocco Commisso: “He’s brought a lot of positive The post Fiorentina’s Palladino: “Gudmundsson will be called up. Commisso? he brings enthusiasm” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Fiorentina vs. Lazio: time to restart
arts.sum: Fiorentina (60.5%) and Lazio (54.8%) are the two teams with the highest percentage of shots on target in this Serie A season; furthermore, only Viola (26) have hit the target more often than the Biancocelesti (23) in the current championship (on par with Milan and Atalanta). Fiorentina are the team against which Lazio have won the most matches (59) and scored the most goals (209) in Serie A –the 150 previous meetings between the two teams is completed by 48 Viola wins and 43 draws.

arts.ttl: Felipe Anderson Admits: ”Never Thought I’d Leave Lazio”
arts.sum: Former Lazio winger Felipe Anderson was expecting to end his playing career in the Italian capital, at least before the opportunity to return home presented itself. The 31-year-old had two spells with the Biancocelesti, the first as a young and aspiring winger which dates all the way back to 2013.
